definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Put together, their information should have been of inestimable value to Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 他們的信息和在一起，對莫斯科具有不可估量的價值。

sentences.english: This will bring much business opportunities, inestimable .
sentences.chinese: 這將帶來多大商機，難以估量。

sentences.english: For civilians, the impact would incalculable.
sentences.chinese: 對於平民，這項研究成果更是具有不可估量的作用。
這是一筆無法估量價值的投資。

sentences.english: The inestimable value of our Federal Union is felt and acknowledged by all.
sentences.chinese: 我們聯邦聯盟的不可估量的價值爲衆人所感受和認可。

sentences.english: Our resources in technical knowledge are imponderable.
sentences.chinese: 我們的技術知識資源是無法估量的。

sentences.english: There are other situations where this kind of measurement is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 還有其他一些情況是不可能進行這種估量的。

sentences.english: GuoZhu wake up, the measure I got drunk hu nonsense words.
sentences.chinese: 國柱醒來，估量本人喝醉後胡胡說話。

sentences.english: It helps them to measure the profitability of products, establish break-even points and so on.
sentences.chinese: 還幫助他們估量產品的盈利能力，定出持平點等等。

sentences.english: We could not measure how bad of the harmfulness caused by the noisiness.
sentences.chinese: 我們無法估量噪音會給我們造成多大的傷害。

sentences.english: The third step involves estimating what resources will be required to accomplish each activity.
sentences.chinese: 第三步就是估量要完成這一活動需要哪些資源。

sentences.english: The greatest of all gifts is the power to estimate things at their true worth.
sentences.chinese: 最了不起的天賦，莫過與能夠估量事物的真正價值。

sentences.english: Many imponderables influence the result of an election.
sentences.chinese: 許多無法估量的因素都會影響選舉結果。

sentences.english: Although a few words, but The role of such incentives are inestimable.
sentences.chinese: 雖然寥寥數語，但這樣激勵所起的作用是不可估量的。

sentences.english: He supposed one of them announced the visit of the Manchu.
sentences.chinese: 他估量其中有一張是通知那位滿清大員蒞臨的消息。

definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
to weigh in the hand/to consider/to ponder
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
from this, it can be seen that...
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
